Sequence Information.Peptide Name: K4S4(1-16) (Dermaseptin-S4 M4K (1-16), Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, amino acid substitution, AMPHIBIAN, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (61.11%) toC18GK: 31%; L=A: 25%.Activity: active against A. baumannii (MIC 6.25 ug/ml). MBC: 12.5 ug/ml.Virus: it inhibited Zika virus (ZIKV)  (IC50 0.82 ug/ml ) (Haddad et al., 2024).Toxicity: Hep-2 Cells (LC50 68.9 ug/ml).MOA:bacteria:A. baumannii: morphological change observed in AFM, implying membrane damage.
Literature Information.Author: Haddad H, Mejri R, de Araujo AR, Za√Øri A.2024
Literature Information.Title: Evaluation of the Antibacterial Activity of New Dermaseptin Derivatives against Acinetobacter baumannii.
